intro: Anacheilium suzanense, commonly known as the Suzan's anacheilium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial species. The plant is characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
